articles.summary: Per Zoho chief scientist Sridhar Vembu, AI is effective at writing “glue code” but still relies on experienced engineers to steer it through prompts, intervention, and domain knowledge. A recent review of Anthropic’s Claude Opus 4.5 showed that while the model is powerful, the generated code was fairly simple, with only a fraction being complex and unnecessarily verbose.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Govt should refrain from hiking income tax surcharge on super-rich, experts say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Tax experts advise the government against increasing income tax surcharges on the super-rich or reintroducing wealth tax in the upcoming budget. Such measures could prompt high-income earners to relocate to low-tax jurisdictions, potentially impacting job creation and investment. Experts suggest focusing on administrative efficiency and existing tax enforcement.

articles.title: Govt to achieve fiscal deficit target of 4.4% in FY26, may even better it: PwC
articles.summary: India is poised to meet its fiscal deficit target of 4.4 percent of GDP for FY26. Experts suggest the government may even surpass this goal, sending a positive message to international investors about fiscal discipline. Despite a revised nominal GDP growth forecast, absolute figures align with budget estimates. This achievement is expected to bolster confidence in India's economic management.

articles.title: CII calls for value unlocking of PSUs through fast-tracking privatisation
articles.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to boost capital expenditure by adopting a strategic approach to privatization for the Union Budget 2026-27. CII proposes a demand-driven selection process, a three-year privatization pipeline, and an institutional framework to expedite disinvestment and unlock significant resources for national development.

articles.title: Budget 2026 key to India’s GCCs becoming the world’s next innovation engines
articles.summary: India's upcoming Union Budget 2026 is poised to bolster its status as a global hub for Global Capability Centres (GCCs), projected to contribute $199 billion by 2030. Policy support, including tax incentives and streamlined regulations, is crucial for this sector's expansion into innovation and business delivery. States are actively supporting GCCs, with a national policy framework further reinforcing this momentum.

articles.title: Budget may roll out ₹23,000 crore incentives to boost local capital goods manufacturing
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India may introduce incentive packages totaling up to ₹23,000 crore in the union budget for FY 2026-27 to boost domestic manufacturing of high-value capital goods. Schemes for construction equipment and automotive sectors are nearing finalization, aiming to reduce import reliance and strengthen global value chains.

Analysts suggest upcoming inflation data and commentary from Federal Reserve officials will also shape market movements.

articles.title: Budget 2026: CII pitches demand-led, faster privatisation of PSEs; seeks three-year pipeline
articles.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to adopt a faster, demand-driven privatisation strategy for public sector enterprises in the Union Budget 2026-27. CII proposes a rolling three-year privatisation pipeline and a phased reduction of government stakes.

articles.title: Govt to achieve fiscal deficit target of 4.4 pc in FY26, may even better it: PwC
Budget 2026–27: CII pitches demand-led disinvestment plan; proposes four-step privatisation roadmap
articles.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) proposed a four-pronged strategy for faster and more predictable disinvestment in their Union Budget 2026-27 recommendations. They advocated for a demand-led approach, a three-year rolling privatization pipeline, a dedicated institutional mechanism, and calibrated disinvestment as an interim measure to unlock significant capital for development priorities.

articles.title: Germany's Merz heads to India to bolster trade, security ties
articles.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is in India to boost economic and security ties. This visit comes ahead of a planned EU-India free trade agreement. Discussions will cover trade, defense deals, and skilled labor recruitment. India seeks broader partnerships to reduce dependence on other nations. German companies see significant opportunities in India's growing market.

articles.title: Trade deals driven by policy, not phone calls: GTRI after Lutnick remarks
articles.summary: A think tank argues that trade deals hinge on policy alignment, not leader calls. This challenges US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick's claim that the India-US trade agreement stalled due to a missed phone call. GTRI asserts that complex negotiations break down over substantive issues like tariffs and market access. The trade impasse reflects hard policy choices, not symbolic gestures.

articles.title: Apparel exporters hanging by a thread amid new tariff threats
articles.summary: India apparel exports: The industry is already under pressure after the US imposed 50% tariffs on India last August, marked by deep discounts, diversion of idle capacity to domestic brands and rerouting of export orders through neighbouring countries.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Capex in the driver’s seat of India’s growth story
articles.summary: Budget 2026: With the FY2027 Union Budget looming, there lies a crucial opportunity for the government to concentrate on amplifying domestic potential and fostering growth. Elevating capital expenditure is key to improving infrastructure and spurring private investments. A renewed spotlight on production-linked incentive schemes can galvanise the National Manufacturing Mission, serving as a lifeline for MSMEs and innovative startups.

articles.title: No call from PM Modi to Trump blocked India-US trade deal, US commerce secy says
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick claimed that a stalled India-US trade deal was due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi not calling President Donald Trump. Lutnick stated the deal required leader-to-leader political signaling, which did not occur, leading to India's discomfort and the lack of a call.

articles.title: Trump's 500% tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: 500% Trump Tariffs? India could pay the price on Russian oil sanctions while China cruises free
articles.summary: A proposed sanctions bill in the US is set to deliver heavy tariffs on nations importing inexpensive Russian oil. India could face significant repercussions, while China appears insulated from these measures.

articles.title: Tejas Networks Q3 Results: Cons loss widens to Rs 196 crore, revenue sinks 88% YoY
articles.summary: Tejas Networks reported a Rs 196.55 crore loss in Q2, impacted by an 88% revenue drop and a significant BSNL order deferral. Despite a large inventory, the company secured private 5G wins and PLI incentives, signaling future growth potential amidst current financial challenges.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,750 amid trade pact worries
articles.summary: Indian stocks extended losses for a fourth session on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty falling amid U.S.-India trade deal uncertainty. However, a rebound in the rupee and renewed foreign investor buying offered some support. Global markets also saw declines, particularly in technology shares, while oil prices advanced due to geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: India–US trade deal: Tariffs remain the key hurdle, not Modi–Trump talks, says former assistant USTR
articles.summary: Differing assessments from US and Indian trade experts suggest that domestic political considerations in Washington and unresolved tariff levels, rather than gaps in negotiations, are keeping the India-US trade agreement on hold, even as official talks are said to be largely complete.

articles.title: US-India trade deal didn't happen because PM Modi didn't call President Trump, claims Lutnick
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary claimed in the podcast interview that India could have had a lower tariff than Indonesia, Vietnam and others if the deal was closed earlier.

articles.title: India-German ties: Why they could take a quantum leap after Chancellor Merz’s visit
articles.summary: Chancellor Merz’s visit should also be seen in a broader European context. As talks on an India–EU Free Trade Agreement gather momentum, Germany’s leadership within Europe can play a catalytic role in bridging differences and shaping a commercially meaningful pact that reflects contemporary supply-chain realities, notes FICCI Director General Jyoti Vij.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets shed ₹8 lakh cr, Trump’s 500% tariff threat, Noida airport telecom tussle & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10—CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights—delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh to get eighth airport as Cabinet clears Dagadarthi project
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet approves Dagadarthi Greenfield Airport in Nellore, set to be the eighth airport, boosting aviation, industrial and logistics links to KRIS City, IFFCO SEZ, and major ports.

articles.title: India approves 22 projects under Electronics Component PLI scheme
articles.summary: The authorized projects are anticipated to lead to investments amounting to ₹41,863 crore and are expected to create almost 37,000 job opportunities. The output from the 22 sanctioned initiatives is estimated to be ₹2.58 lakh crore.

articles.title: PM-KISAN 22nd instalment: Key date and all about Farmer ID, e-KYC
articles.summary: Here is when farmers in India can expect the 22nd instalment under the PM-KISAN scheme to be released.

articles.title: Income tax return filing: Here's what happens if you miss the ITR deadline
articles.summary: Missing the Income Tax Return filing deadline doesn’t end your tax obligation, but it can make it more expensive and restrictive. From late filing fees and interest charges to limits on refunds and loss carry-forward, this photo story breaks down what changes when you file late and why timing matters as much as accuracy.

articles.title: How Indians earned in 2025: ClearTax's ITR filing report reveals shift to multi-source income
articles.summary: ClearTax’s 2025 report shows India’s shift to multi-income sources, with millennials and Gen Z driving growth in business, trading, investments, and digital assets, especially via ITR-2 and ITR-3.

articles.title: Affordable energy for 1.4 billion people remains top priority: MEA on 500% US tariff threat
articles.summary: Amid reports that the US administration is considering a 500% tariff on countries continuing to buy Russian oil, the government says its focus remains on securing affordable and dependable energy supplies.

articles.title: Is Micah Parsons playing tonight vs Bears? Packers star shares injury update on 'painful recovery process'
articles.summary: On Friday, Micah Parsons responded to a fan question about his recovery on X, writing, “This recovery process is incredibly challenging and painful.”

विजय त्रिवेदी की नई पुस्तक में अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी के विचार, व्यक्तित्व और राजनीतिक विरासत का जीवंत व प्रभावशाली चित्रण
इंडियाएआई, इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स और सूचना प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय तथा उत्तर प्रदेश सरकार लखनऊ में क्षेत्रीय एआई इम्पैक्ट कॉन्फ्रेंस का आयोजन करेंगे
केंद्रीय संचार मंत्री ने मध्य प्रदेश में नवीनीकृत एवं आधुनिक छह डाकघरों का उद्घाटन किया; शिवपुरी में 111 करोड़ रुपये की लागत वाले राष्ट्रीय डाक प्रशिक्षण केंद्र की घोषणा की
केंद्रीय स्वास्थ्य एवं परिवार कल्याण मंत्रालय ने क्षेत्रीय प्रदर्शनी 2026 वाइब्रेंट गुजरात में स्वास्थ्य मंडप की स्थापना की
कच्छ और सौराष्ट्र क्षेत्र के लिए आयोजित वाइब्रेंट गुजरात रीजनल कॉन्फ्रेंस में प्रधानमंत्री के संबोधन का मूल पाठ
भारत का ऊर्जा रूपांतरण 'वसुधैव कुटुंबकम- एक पृथ्वी, एक परिवार, एक भविष्य' के सिद्धांत पर आधारित है: केंद्रीय मंत्री श्री प्रल्हाद जोशी
प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेन्द्र मोदी ने राजकोट में कच्छ और सौराष्ट्र क्षेत्र के लिए वाइब्रेंट गुजरात रीजनल कॉन्फ्रेंस का उद्घाटन किया
भारतीय नौसेना ने नई दिल्ली विश्व पुस्तक मेले 2026 में भारत की समुद्री विरासत का प्रदर्शन किया
केंद्रीय मंत्री डॉ. जितेंद्र सिंह ने ‘विकसित भारत यंग लीडर्स डायलॉग’ में भाग लेने वाले जम्मू-कश्मीर और लद्दाख के दल के साथ अनौपचारिक बातचीत की
स्वस्थ शरीर सशक्त नेतृत्व की नींव है: डॉ. मनसुख मांडविया ने नई दिल्ली में आयोजित 56वें ​​फिट इंडिया संडेज ऑन साइकिल कार्यक्रम के दौरान यह बात कही
गुजरात में सोमनाथ स्वाभिमान पर्व के दौरान प्रधानमंत्री के संबोधन का मूल पाठ
श्रीमद् विजयरत्न सुंदर सूरीश्वरजी महाराज की 500वीं पुस्तक के विमोचन के दौरान प्रधानमंत्री के संबोधन का मूल पाठ
प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी ने गुजरात के सोमनाथ में सोमनाथ स्वाभिमान पर्व को संबोधित किया
भद्रकाली मंदिर के शिलालेख सोमनाथ की ऐतिहासिक घटनाओं और इसके पुनरुद्धार में कुमारपाल की भूमिका का क्रम में विवरण वर्णन करते हैं
मत्स्यपालन, पशुपालन और डेयरी मंत्रालय की तृतीय हिंदी सलाहकार समिति की हुई बैठक
प्रधानमंत्री ने सोमनाथ की अपनी यात्रा की झलकियां साझा की

MoJS minister has acknowledged non-feasibility of dams   need for work on alternatives. However, the picture on ground is quite the opposite.

Though the Assam CM in June month hinted at its cancellation but no formal decision has been taken so far. It is worth mentioning that every section of society including villagers, activists, experts, women, students and even political leaders have openly raised their voices against unjustified hydro projects in North East. articles.title: Dec 2025: Vishnugad Pipalkoti HEP Tunnel Accident in Uttarakhand
articles.summary: As per district administration of 60 injured workers 42 were admitted in district hospital Gopeshwar while 17 were under treatment Vivekanand hospital in Pipalkoti. About four-five workers in the district hospital are with bone fracture injuries. Most of the workers received minor injuries while five to six workers suffered severe injuries. Condition of all of the affected workers is reported to be stable. The tunnel work was stopped following the incident.

articles.title: DRP 291225: Looking back on 2025, Looking forward to 2026
articles.summary: On the positive side, if one can call that, the uproar that came against the recent Supreme Court definition of Aravalli hills following a Union government committee’s recommendation provides a faint silver-line in the dark clouds. How useful this will be will depend on the next steps the apex Court takes in the matter after staying its own order of Nov 20 on Dec 29, next hearing to happen in new year on January 21.

articles.title: DRP 221225: Is it so difficult to understand the importance of Aravalli Mountains?
articles.summary: What exactly is driving the unacceptable decision of the apex court? According to the Forest Survey of India, applying the new definition would result in only around 8.7% of the mapped Aravalli landforms being eligible for protection, leaving a substantial portion unregulated.

articles.title: 2025: Pump Storage Projects Developments in India
articles.summary: Most of the PSPs are being proposed in sensitive region of Western Ghats and tribal dominated population endangering both the wildlife and vulnerable population.

articles.title: 2025: Silt accumulation in Indian Dams: Reducing entry of silt is the only viable option
articles.summary: Unfortunately, once silt is inside the large dam storage, there is no economically viable way to remove it. But the governments seem least bothered about reducing the entry of silt into the reservoir by maintaining better catchment health and ensuring that upstream projects do not dump silt into the river. Talking, planning about silt removal from the dams have remained just that so far: Talks. We still lack a national silt management policy and credible action plan.

The political and economic importance of such projects also influences legal standards, regulatory practice

articles.title: TREADS: Transboundary Rivers, Ecologies & Development Studies
articles.summary: TREADS programme encompasses and echoes our research and policy interests in transboundary political ecologies, river water governance and development studies. We are interested in politics and ecologies (relationships) across boundaries – after Neil Smith’s “markers of difference” – at different scales. We pursue our interests in this generic sense of transboundary political spaces, at present focused primarily on transboundary river water governance.

articles.title: The Technology & Society Initiative
articles.summary: Recent technology-powered advances – artificial intelligence and deep learning ecosystems, drones, the app economy, blockchain and crypto-currencies, and quantum computing, to name a few – have transformed interactions between States and citizens, and relations inter se private entities and individuals. On the regulatory front, governments worldwide face the unenviable task of directing innovation by optimally balancing risks and rewards. When deployed for governance, technology also raises conc

articles.title: State Capacity Initiative
articles.summary: The State Capacity Initiative at CPR is an interdisciplinary research and practice programme focused on addressing the challenges of the 21st-century Indian state. The purpose of this initiative is to place the critical challenges of building state capacity at the heart of the field of policy research in India, where it has always belonged but remains surprisingly marginalised. We therefore start with first principles and ground ourselves in existing realities to deepen and expand the understand

articles.title: Scaling City Institutions for India Initiative (SCI-FI)
articles.summary: The Scaling City Institutions for India (SCI-FI) programme aims to better understand ‘governance scale’ in Indian cities in tandem with ‘sector specific socio-economic scales’. Through research, the programme aims to inform stakeholders, including the three tiers of the government, to develop better informed policies and programmes enabling improved governance and service delivery. It has two key thematic focus in areas of Land, Housing and Planning, and Water and Sanitation. The SCI-FI programm

articles.title: Land Rights Initiative
articles.summary: India faces serious challenges in constructing development paths that are socially inclusive, ecologically sustainable, politically feasible, and in accordance with the Rule of Law. Current resource intensive growth strategies have caused serious environmental degradation and endangered the livelihoods of many vulnerable groups, particularly the scheduled tribes and other traditional communities. These vulnerable groups rely solely on land and the environment for sustenance. However, underneath

articles.title: Initiative on Climate, Energy & Environment
articles.summary: The Initiative on Climate, Energy and Environment at the Centre for Policy Research (CPR-ICEE) aims to stimulate an informed debate on the laws, policies and institutions shaping climate, energy and environmental governance in India. articles.title: Fast-track courts may not be the cure
articles.summary: The Karnataka District Judiciary Reforms Bill 2025 is the most recent attempt at judicial reform in the state. In 2024, the legislature enacted amendments to the Civil Procedure Code (CPC), introducing case management hearings in district courts, bef...Read more at: https://www.deccanherald.com/opinion/fast-track-courts-may-not-be-the-cure-3816439

articles.title: Karnataka’s new case clock: Can time-bound justice deliver?
articles.summary: The Karnataka government recently passed a state amendment to the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (CPC) and introduced case management hearings in civil trials. Case management hearings are widely used across the world to streamline court proceedings by setting clear timelines for completing various stages of a case.

articles.title: Civil Disputes, Criminal Justice Resolutions
articles.summary: In this piece, Lakshmi Menon examines how delays, bottlenecks, and weak enforcement in civil courts drive lawyers and litigants to misuse criminal law for quicker settlements. She highlights the unpopularity of civil courts, the systemic nature of the problem and argues that real change lies not in blaming individuals but in pursuing institutional reforms to strengthen our civil courts.

articles.title: Set the guardrails for AI use in courtrooms
articles.summary: In July this year, the Kerala High Court published a set of guidelines for Artificial Intelligence (AI) use by the district judiciary (“Policy Regarding Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools in District Judiciary”). As the first policy in the country directly addressing AI use in judicial processes and setting out strict safeguards, it is timely.

articles.title: Why ICAI’s audit limit is misguided and outdated
articles.summary: From FY 2027, each partner in a CA firm will be allowed to sign no more than 60 tax audit reports a year—a proposal the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) says will “improve audit quality and manage workload.”

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

The DRT’s restraint on recovery action was found to be contrary to law and was set aside. articles.title: Transfer Pricing Appeal Dismissed Due to Functional Dissimilarity of Comparables
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court upheld exclusion of multiple comparables after finding them functionally different from a low-risk investment advisory service provider. It held that such findings were factual and did not raise any substantial question of law. The post Transfer Pricing Appeal Dismissed Due to Functional Dissimilarity of Comparables appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Auction Sale Set Aside for Outdated Property Valuation Before Sale: DART Allahabad
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal held that the bank violated Rule 8(5) by conducting the auction nearly ten months after valuation without obtaining a fresh report. The sale and subsequent actions were set aside on this ground. The post Auction Sale Set Aside for Outdated Property Valuation Before Sale: DART Allahabad appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Stay on Income Tax Demand Denied After Instalment Request to AO
articles.summary: The court refused to grant a mandatory stay on income tax demand where the taxpayer had earlier proposed paying dues in instalments. The ruling underscores that voluntary payment proposals can weaken claims for interim protection. The post Stay on Income Tax Demand Denied After Instalment Request to AO appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Fraud-Linked Liability Treated as ‘Debt’ Under RDB Act; DRAT Dismisses Appeal
articles.summary: The tribunal held that objections to the maintainability of a bank’s Original Application claiming over Rs. 50 crores were rejected, affirming DRT jurisdiction over debts arising from fraudulent withdrawals. The post Fraud-Linked Liability Treated as ‘Debt’ Under RDB Act; DRAT Dismisses Appeal appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: SARFAESI Sale Invalid for Breach of Mandatory 30-Day Auction Notice Rule: DART
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal upheld cancellation of the auction after finding that possession and sale notices were not properly served. It ruled that recovery actions without statutory compliance cannot be sustained. The post SARFAESI Sale Invalid for Breach of Mandatory 30-Day Auction Notice Rule: DART appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Right to Cross-Examine Customs Officials as They Acted in Official Capacity: Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Court held that customs officials acting in their official capacity cannot be cross-examined as a matter of right. Cross-examination is permissible only where specific prejudice is shown. The post No Right to Cross-Examine Customs Officials as They Acted in Official Capacity: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Entire Bogus Purchases Can’t Be Disallowed When Sales Are Accepted: ITAT Mumbai
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that where identical facts existed in earlier years, the addition for alleged bogus purchases must follow past precedent. It restricted the addition to 5 percent, applying the principle of consistency. The post Entire Bogus Purchases Can’t Be Disallowed When Sales Are Accepted: ITAT Mumbai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Accommodation Entry Case: ITAT Reduces Commission Rate to 1%
articles.summary: The Tribunal upheld reopening and reassessment but reduced the estimated commission income from 2% to 1% due to absence of comparative or segmental justification. The post Accommodation Entry Case: ITAT Reduces Commission Rate to 1% appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Redevelopment Receipts Can’t Be Taxed Twice: ITAT Mumbai
articles.summary: Emphasising the principle against double taxation, the Tribunal held that amounts taxed in members’ hands cannot again be assessed in the society’s hands, subject to factual verification. The post Redevelopment Receipts Can’t Be Taxed Twice: ITAT Mumbai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: 2262-Day Excise Appeal Delay Condoned as Amnesty Scheme Pursuit Held Bona Fide
articles.summary: The Court condoned an extraordinary delay after finding that the appellant was genuinely pursuing settlement under a State-backed amnesty scheme. articles.title: KGST Penalty Proceedings Time-Barred as They Were Not Started Within Reasonable Time: Kerala HC
articles.summary: The Court held that penalty proceedings under the KGST Act cannot be initiated after an unreasonable delay. articles.title: CPC Addition on IGST Refund Sent Back for Fresh Examination

articles.title: Delhi HC Set Aside GST Demand Due to Lack of Proper Hearing & Portal Notice Issues
articles.summary: The court held that orders passed after uploading notices only under the Additional Notices tab, without effective hearing, violate procedural fairness.
