articles.title: Dharmendra Pradhan defends higher education overhaul Bill—‘no threat to autonomy of states’
articles.summary: Union Minister’s remarks come after Oppn parties raise concerns about ‘excessive centralisation’ of higher education in India. Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill referred to JPC.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: India tightens crypto noose: Live selfies, geo-tagging now mandatory for users
articles.summary: India has tightened rules for cryptocurrency exchanges, introducing tougher AML and KYC checks. Users must complete live selfie verification, location tracking and enhanced identity checks, while risky tokens and ICOs are discouraged. Exchanges must monitor high-risk clients closely and keep detailed records to combat money laundering and terrorism financing risks.

articles.title: India proposes forcing smartphone makers to give source code in security overhaul: Report
articles.summary: India is reportedly proposing new security rules for smartphones. These rules include sharing source code and making software changes. Tech companies like Apple and Samsung are opposing these measures. They argue the requirements lack global precedent and risk revealing proprietary information.

articles.title: Meta denies data breach of 17.5 million users; asks users to ignore password reset emails
articles.summary: In 2021, Facebook, another Meta company, reported that data of over 350 million users had been exposed from publicly accessible profiles but not breached. Data breaches at other major social media platforms, X and LinkedIn, were reported in 2018 and 2021, impacting billions of users.

articles.title: Under EU scrutiny, Musk vows to release X’s algorithm code every four weeks
articles.summary: This is not the first time X has promised to make its algorithms open source. Elon Musk had made similar commitments in 2022 and 2023. However, the latest publicly available update to its recommendation code dates back to March 2023.

articles.title: ITAT rejects Binny Bansal's 'non-resident' status claim
articles.summary: The Bengaluru bench of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) has rejected Flipkart co-founder Binny Bansal's claim of non-resident status for assessment year 2020-21, thereby denying him the benefit of the India-Singapore Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA).

articles.title: The man who could be Apple's next CEO
articles.summary: Around 2018, Apple weighed adding costly laser tech to iPhones, highlighting the cautious leadership style of hardware chief John Ternus. Now seen as a leading successor to CEO Tim Cook, Ternus embodies Apple’s incremental, profit-focused approach amid succession planning and innovation challenges.

articles.title: Cloudflare threatens Olympic services over piracy fine
articles.summary: US internet company Cloudflare has threatened to pull its services in Italy, including for the Winter Olympics, after being fined 14 million euros ($16 million) for failing to tackle online piracy.

articles.title: Uber Eats driver criticises Tesla Model Y; promotes 1999 Fiat in viral exchange
articles.summary: The driver reportedly told the customer that the two-decade-old Fiat was “built to last” and cheaper to maintain. The post drew mixed reactions, with some users backing the claim and joking that older European models often outlast modern cars because of their mechanical simplicity, while others defended Tesla’s Model Y for its energy efficiency and advanced technology. The debate comes as Tesla has lost its position as the world’s largest EV maker, after sales fell for a second straight year, an

articles.title: Google founders Larry Page, Sergey Brin pull back from California over wealth tax fears
articles.summary: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are reducing their California business presence, moving companies to Nevada and buying property elsewhere, amid concern over a proposed California wealth tax on billionaires. The measure has sparked debate, with tech leaders warning it could drive capital and innovation out of Silicon Valley.

articles.title: TN's iTNT Hub inks pact with XeedQ GmbH for quantum computing programmes
articles.summary: The programme will be anchored by the Tamil Nadu Technology Hub (iTNT), a public–private initiative supported by the TN government that is an emerging and deeptech innovation network that works closely with academic institutions, startups, and research communities across the state. XeedQ GmbH will provide the remote access, quantum hardware, technical expertise, and learning support as part of this engagement.

articles.title: FCC approves SpaceX plan to deploy an additional 7,500 Starlink satellites
articles.summary: The agency said the additional satellites will provide direct-to-cell connectivity outside the United States and supplemental U.S. coverage, which will allow for next-generation mobile services as well as internet speeds of up to 1 gigabit per second.

articles.title: Chinese AI unicorn MiniMax soars 109% in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Shares in Chinese AI startup MiniMax soared 109% as it went public in Hong Kong on Friday, raising US$619 million in a sign that strong investor demand is rewarding the country's rapidly developing sector. Friday's shares performance shows investors have a "strong appetite for China's tech sector and the AI story", Gary Ng, senior economist at Natixis Corporate and Investment Banking, told AFP. The whole AI sector is still at an early stage of development, which requires massive investment, he s

articles.title: Grok limits image generation to paid users; not enough, says govt
articles.summary: MeitY's concernThe issue will remain if X continues to allow the generation, hosting, uploading or sharing of obscene and illegal content that hurts the privacy and dignity of our citizens, especially women and children, in any manner

articles.title: Democratic senators demand Apple, Google take X and Grok off app stores over sexual images: Report
articles.summary: Three Democratic ⁠US senators are ‌calling ‌on Apple and ‌Alphabet's Google to remove X and Grok ​from ​their respective ‌app ‍stores ‍over the spread of ‌nonconsensual sexual images of women and ‍minors on ‍the ⁠platforms, ⁠NBC News reported Friday.

articles.title: L&T Semiconductor Technologies forays into cellular IoT module business
articles.summary: The first module, powered by Qualcomm, will be produced in collaboration with Indian EMS partners to ensure scale and quality for deployments in both domestic and global markets.

articles.title: VC firm Andreessen Horowitz raises over $15 billion across multiple funds
articles.summary: The funds, which account for over 18% of all VC funds allocated in the US last year, will be invested in core technology platforms, including AI, cryptocurrency, and others. The geopolitical developments have caused the firm to change its investment strategy to invest in emerging technologies that can compete with China.

articles.title: TSMC fourth-quarter revenue jumps 20%, beats forecasts
articles.summary: TSMC reported a 20.45% increase in fourth-quarter revenue from a year earlier, ‌beating the market forecast, as demand for the company's products leapt in response to surging interest in AI applications.

articles.title: Physical AI dominates CES but humanity will still have to wait a while for humanoid servants
articles.summary: The annual event draws the biggest companies from the global tech and auto industries who this ⁠year underscored the shift from AI software to "physical AI" with robotics, humanoids and autonomous driving technology.

articles.title: China probes competition among food delivery platforms to curb price war
articles.summary: China will investigate cutthroat ‍competition among food delivery ​platforms operated by tech firms such as Meituan ⁠and Alibaba, aiming to rein in price wars that have eroded profits and contributed to deflationary pressures plaguing the economy.

articles.title: EU considers designating WhatsApp as very large platform, spokesperson says
articles.summary: The European Commission is considering recategorising Meta's WhatsApp to make ‌it more responsible ‌for tackling illegal and harmful ‌content, a spokesperson said on Friday.

articles.title: Meta strikes nuclear power agreements with three companies
articles.summary: Meta and other Big Tech companies want to secure long-term electricity supplies as artificial intelligence and data centers increase U.S. power demand ‌for the first time in two decades.

articles.title: Grok turns off AI image generation for non-payers after nudes backlash
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has turned off its image creation feature for non-paying users following backlash over its use to create sexualized deepfakes of women and children. Some users reportedly used Grok to generate pictures of women and children undressed, sometimes putting them in sexualized positions.

articles.title: SoftBank cuts Ola Electric stake to 13.5% amid continued investor sell-offs
articles.summary: SoftBank has cut its stake in Ola Electric to 13.53% after selling shares over recent months. The offloading comes as major investors trim stake amid regulatory pressure, rising competition and operational challenges. Ola’s market share and valuation also dropped sharply over the past year.

articles.title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses manufacturing of sovereign, high-end GPUs in India with Nvidia officials
articles.summary: India is stepping up plans to build its own graphics processors after talks between minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nvidia executives. The discussions covered sovereign GPUs and local manufacturing of advanced AI devices. The government is also expanding subsidised access to GPUs to boost domestic AI development.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI quarterly net loss widens to $1.46 billion: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s AI firm xAI posted a net loss of $1.46 billion for the September quarter, despite revenue almost doubling to $107 million, according to a report by Bloomberg. However, when contacted ‌by ‍Reuters for comment, xAI ‍replied with the message, "Legacy Media Lies." This comes as xAI announced a $20 billion funding round to expand its AI capabilities.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s xAI plans to invest $20 billion in a vast data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, the state’s biggest-ever private project. The site will host "the world's largest supercomputer" with 2 gigawatts of computing power. The announcement comes as xAI faces scrutiny over its data centre projects in the Memphis area.

articles.title: TikTok picked by FIFA as video content partner at 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: FIFA has named TikTok its first preferred social media video platform at the men’s World Cup. Creators will gain special access and limited match content at the 2026 tournament. This partnership will continue through the end of 2026. FIFA said that the deal builds on FIFA and TikTok’s collaboration for the 2023 Women’s World Cup, which generated tens of billions of views.

articles.title: Apple Card switches hands but no immediate changes for users
articles.summary: Apple has confirmed JPMorgan will become the new issuer of the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, with no changes for customers. Rewards, savings features and Mastercard access will stay the same during the transition. The deal, closing in about two years, solidifies JPMorgan’s leading position in the US credit card market.

articles.title: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
articles.summary: EU antitrust officials will decide by February 10 on Google owner Alphabet’s planned $32 billion purchase of cybersecurity firm Wiz. Announced last March, the acquisition secured the US green light in November last year. Tech ‍deals have in recent years faced ‌intense regulatory scrutiny on concerns that dominant companies may further boost their market power.

articles.title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
articles.summary: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

articles.title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
articles.summary: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

articles.title: Humanoid robots go for knockout in high-tech Vegas fight night
articles.summary: At a CES-adjacent event in Las Vegas, humanoid robots battled in an Ultimate Fighting Robot match at BattleBots Arena. Controlled by human pilots, the MMA-style fights aim to boost entertainment, attract fans to humanoid robotics, and collect movement data for research and development.

articles.title: Dose of uncertainty: Experts wary of AI health gadgets at CES
articles.summary: At CES, health gadgets promise better heart, fertility and menopause care, but experts warn of shaky accuracy and privacy. As the FDA relaxes oversight under AI-friendly policies, innovators tout access and efficiency, while critics stress bias, data misuse and that consumer tech can’t replace doctors.

articles.title: Gmail's new AI features, turning it into personal assistant
articles.summary: The new AI features announced Thursday could herald a pivotal moment for Gmail, a service that transformed email when it was introduced nearly 22 years ago. Since then, Gmail has amassed more than 3 billion users to become nearly as ubiquitous as Google's search engine.

articles.title: IIIT Dharwad to deploy India's first commercial quantum computer, says Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Dharwad (IIIT-D), will deploy India's first commercial quantum computer at its newly announced Centre for Excellence in Quantum AI and Computing, said Karnataka IT/BT Minister Priyank Kharge.

articles.title: Flipkart appoints Gunjan Bhartia as SVP business finance
articles.summary: The company said that Bhartia will lead business finance for Flipkart's in-house logistics unit eKart across all verticals. He has previously held senior positions at companies such as GE and Coupang.

articles.title: Apple loses Safari lead designer to Browser Company, the firm behind AI browsers Arc & Dia
articles.summary: Apple's senior leadership continues to see significant departures, with its lead Safari designer, Marco Triverio, joining The Browser Company. This move means The Browser Company now employs lead designers from every Safari era overlapping with their Arc and Dia browsers (2020-2025). The company aims to build the industry's most exceptional AI interface and product talent team.

articles.title: Microsoft layoffs: Company denies reports of 22,000 job cuts
articles.summary: Microsoft has denied reports it plans to cut up to 22,000 jobs, calling the claims unfounded. The rumours, which spread online, suggested wide-ranging layoffs across key divisions - gaming, Azure, and sales. While recent job cuts have fuelled scepticism, the company says no such move is planned.

articles.title: Dancing isn't enough: Industry pushes for practical robots
articles.summary: Humanoid robots danced, somersaulted, dealt blackjack and played ping-pong at the Consumer Electronics Show this week, but some in the industry are impatient for them to become more useful, not just a promise of things to come. - According to the Consumer Technology Association that runs CES, the robotics industry is showing dynamism and potential.

articles.title: Discord, Snap investor Niko Bonatsos departs General Catalyst, plans new VC firm
articles.summary: Niko Bonatsos has quit General Catalyst after a 15-year tenure, a mutual decision that sees him exploring new ventures. He plans to launch his own firm, focusing on backing young founders, particularly within the burgeoning AI startup scene. This exit follows other senior departures from the venture capital firm.

articles.title: JPMorgan to replace Goldman as Apple Card issuer
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase will replace Goldman Sachs as the issuer of the Apple Card, bringing over $20 billion in balances to its platform. The deal strengthens JPMorgan’s credit card business, while Goldman continues to scale back consumer operations. Completion depends on regulatory approval and is expected in about two years.

articles.title: Amagi Media trims IPO size, targets $869 million post-money valuation to woo investors
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs has cut the size and pricing of its IPO, valuing the company below its previous $1.4 billion valuation. The move reflects strong cash flows, reduced need for dilution and investor feedback. The listing highlights a wider reset in valuations across enterprise software firms.

articles.title: Arali Ventures nets 23x return on full exit from HBOX
articles.summary: This follows remote health technology startup HBOX securing strategic growth investment from the Charlesbank Technology Opportunities Fund. Arali Ventures had invested in HBOX at the time of its inception. HBOX is a US-headquartered remote health technology startup, with its core engineering and delivery teams based in India.

articles.title: Trump shifts FTC pick to White House role advising on tech and competition
articles.summary: The White House ‍is withdrawing its nomination ​of Ryan Baasch for a Federal Trade Commission ⁠seat and instead naming him deputy director of the National Economic Council, elevating his role in shaping tech, telecom and competition policy.

articles.title: Tech firms must block unsolicited nude images under new UK rules
articles.summary: Technology companies in Britain will be required to block ‍unsolicited sexual images under ​online safety rules taking effect on Thursday, as governments ⁠worldwide step up efforts to curb abuse and risks linked to artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Chinese tech companies, led by Zhipu AI, to rise in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Three ‍Chinese technology firms ​are set to ⁠debut higher on Thursday after raising a combined HK$9.3 billion ($1.19 ‌billion), ‌setting the tone for what investors ‌hope will be a busier year for new listings in Hong Kong.

articles.title: Judge indicates Elon Musk's fraud lawsuit against OpenAI will head to trial
articles.summary: A US judge has signalled that a jury will hear Elon Musk’s lawsuit accusing OpenAI of misleading him over its shift from a non-profit to a profit-driven company. The case will go to trial, likely involving testimony from Musk and chief Sam Altman. A 2017 diary entry by OpenAI executive Greg Brockman was among the information that Gonzalez Rogers cited to support her rationale for allowing Musk's lawsuit to go to trial.

articles.title: Spain, Germany, Belgium, Poland emerging as key export destinations for India within EU
articles.summary: India's exports to European Union are showing strong growth. Spain is a standout market with significant export increases. Germany continues to be a stable destination for Indian products. Belgium and Poland also show positive export trends. These developments are occurring as India and the EU negotiate a free trade agreement, promising further bilateral trade growth.

articles.title: Explainer: Simplified Income Tax Act, 2025, to come into force from April 1
articles.summary: A new Income Tax Act, 2025, will replace the 1961 law on April 1, simplifying direct tax legislation and reducing its volume by 50%. The revenue-neutral act eliminates the distinction between assessment and previous years, introducing a single 'tax year' framework. Budget 2026-27 changes will be incorporated.

articles.title: Budget 2026-27: In the AI race, India can't afford to jog
articles.summary: India's digital sector is emerging as a crucial "power-lifter" amidst global economic realignments, strengthening domestic resilience and expanding its international footprint. With significant investments in infrastructure and deep technology, India is poised to convert its digital scale into sustained leadership, leveraging its complex ecosystem for AI innovation and securing infrastructure sovereignty.

articles.title: India eyes new markets with US trade deal limbo
articles.summary: India is aggressively seeking trade deals to open markets for exporters and soften the blow of steep US tariffs, as efforts to secure an agreement with Washington remain elusive. And while a free trade agreement (FTA) with New Zealand added little to Indian export growth, it secured $20 billion in foreign investment, increased visa access and showed Washington that New Delhi is willing to compromise.

articles.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to attend US critical minerals meet amid China’s supply-chain weaponisation
articles.summary: India is set to participate in a key US-organized meet on critical minerals, with Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw likely to represent the nation. This engagement signals a broader US effort to diversify supply chains away from China's dominance. India will also join the US-led Pax Silica initiative ahead of its AI summit.

articles.title: Budget 2026: States seek higher capex aid, GST loss compensation in pre-Budget talks with Sitharaman
articles.summary: States met with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman ahead of the FY27 budget. They asked for more special assistance for capital investments and help with GST revenue losses. Increased funding for urban and rural schemes was also requested. Support for housing programs and disaster management was highlighted. The minister urged states to undertake reforms for India's developed nation goal by 2047.

articles.title: India, EU FTA talks: ministers say good progress made, full steam in coming days
articles.summary: India and the European Union are moving closer to a free trade agreement. Discussions in Brussels showed good progress with fewer issues remaining. Both sides are committed to a fair and ambitious deal. Negotiations are speeding up to finalize the pact soon. This agreement is crucial for economic ties between India and the EU.

articles.title: India’s record rice crop is set to deepen slide in global prices
articles.summary: India's record rice harvest is flooding the global market, pressuring prices as demand weakens and key buyers impose stricter import rules. Farmers may face significant rate cuts to compete with rivals like Thailand and Vietnam. Analysts predict a potential drop of $15 to $25 per ton by spring due to a lack of immediate African and Middle Eastern interest.

articles.title: India's 2025 rice exports surge to near record as curbs lifted
articles.summary: India’s rice exports rose 19.4% last year to 21.55 million tonnes, the second-highest level on record, after the government lifted all export curbs. Officials said shipments recovered quickly from March as supplies improved on record production and the last restrictions imposed in 2022–23 were removed.

articles.title: Telangana govt to promote $3 trillion economy goal at WEF Davos 2026
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy said the state will actively promote its Telangana Rising 2047 vision and aim for a $3 trillion economy at the World Economic Forum in Davos 2026. The delegation will showcase the state’s transformative growth plans, revisit past investment commitments, and highlight opportunities in innovation, technology, and inclusive development.

articles.title: PM Modi made eight calls in 2025: India rejects US claim on trade deal delay
articles.summary: Modi and Trump have spoken on the phone “on eight occasions during 2025, covering different aspects of our wide-ranging partnership”, external affairs ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said on Friday. Lutnick had said that India was given “three Fridays” to clinch a trade deal with Washington last year and that Modi had to call Trump to close it.

articles.title: RBI trims US treasury holding to below $200 bn amid gold rush
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced its holdings in US Treasuries. This strategic move sees the central bank increasing its gold reserves. The shift aims to diversify foreign exchange reserves. This diversification is a response to global economic uncertainties. India joins other nations in this trend. The RBI's forex reserves remain stable overall.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India may peg nominal growth for FY27 at 10%
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: India's upcoming budget may target a nominal growth rate of around 10 percent. This is an increase from the estimated 8 percent for the current fiscal year. Economic growth is expected to remain strong. Inflation is also projected to rise in the next fiscal year due to base effects.

articles.title: Financial Services secretary flags digital risks, says AI key to tackling mule accounts
articles.summary: The central bank has introduced initiatives such as MuleHunter.ai to combat mule accounts used for fraudulent transactions. The AI tool delivers high accuracy and precision with significantly low false-positive rates and is currently deployed across 20 commercial banks.

articles.title: In a fragmenting world, India backs rules-based global economic system, says Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Delivering the first Bibek Debroy Memorial Lecture on the them Indian Economy: A Story of Rising Credibility, Shaktikanta Das, principal secretary 2 to prime minister, said the global economy is at an inflection point, with geopolitical rivalries, protectionist trade policies and weakening multilateral institutions reshaping cross-border commerce and investment flows.

articles.title: Budget Session 2026 to start from January 28, confirms Kiren Rijiju; Budget presentation likely on Feb 1
articles.summary: Budget Session will start on 28 January 2026 and continue till 2 April 2026. President Droupadi Murmu has approved the summoning of Parliament for the Budget Session 2026 and the Union Budget is likely be presented on February 1, a Sunday, followed by a recess for committee examinations. The session will reconvene on March 9.

articles.title: RBI deputy governor pitches for collaboration to deal with frauds
articles.summary: T Rabi Sankar said collaboration between banks and central bank owned Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) will both quicken and enhance the capability of these risk mechanisms.

articles.title: Ways and Means Advances limit for Delhi govt fixed at Rs 890 cr: RBI
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has set the Ways and Means Advances limit for the Delhi government at Rs 890 crore. This move will assist the city government in managing temporary gaps between its income and expenses. The central bank will also conduct the Delhi government's general banking business starting January 09, 2026.

articles.title: Budget 2026: PHDCCI recommends reform agenda as spotlight falls on banks, MSMEs
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India's industry body PHDCCI anticipates new government reforms. These include deeper divestment and privatization of public sector enterprises. The aim is to boost corporate activity and protect the economy from export uncertainty. The upcoming budget may clarify the future of public sector banks. Reforms are also expected to support MSMEs and the financial sector.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves fall $9.8 billion to $686.8 billion in first week of 2026
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a significant drop of $9.809 billion. Reserves stood at $686.801 billion in the week ending January 02, 2026. This follows a rise in the previous week. Foreign currency assets and gold reserves also decreased. The Reserve Bank of India monitors these movements closely.

articles.title: Digital frauds: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra calls for collaboration between regulator, regulated to protect customers
articles.summary: While telling banks and other regulated entities to continue to improve their tools, techniques and processes in preventing and tackling digital frauds, Malhotra urged for collaborations in building analytics and tools to detect mule accounts and suspicious transactions timely and pre-emptively.

articles.title: India to focus on skilled jobs, employment quality to achieve inclusive growth: EAC-PM chief S Mahendra Dev
articles.summary: India is shifting its focus towards generating skilled employment and improving job quality, an essential step for sustainable economic development. With a target growth rate of 7.7 percent from 2022-23 to 2025-26, the nation envisions a future where investments, domestic savings, and exports flourish. Emphasizing the manufacturing sector is seen as key to creating more labor-intensive job opportunities.

articles.title: ‘PM Modi and Trump have spoken eight times in 2025’: India rejects Lutnick’s claim that stalled trade talks were due to lack of outreach
articles.summary: India has firmly countered the statements made by US Commerce Secretary Lutnick regarding stalled trade discussions. Officials affirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump are in regular communication, with the Ministry of External Affairs underscoring ongoing high-level interactions.

articles.title: India’s growth miracle in danger? Former CEA warns of tariffs, Chinese imports, and fiscal risks
articles.summary: India's economic landscape is navigating turbulent waters, cautions former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian. He highlights the looming threats posed by US tariffs and competitive pressures from Chinese exports. Moreover, he notes the challenges of domestic fiscal health in this climate.

articles.title: Imbibe spirit of regulations, just don't follow tick-box based compliance culture: RBI Governor to regulated entities
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra called for financial institutions to adopt the spirit of regulations. He stressed collaboration to fight digital frauds. Digital channels offer benefits but also risks. The Governor emphasized partnership between regulators and regulated entities for system stability and consumer protection.

articles.title: RBI MPC 2026: No need to waste bullet when growth high, inflation low, says PwC on central banks's rate cut
articles.summary: RBI Monetary Policy Committee 2026: PwC expert Ranen Banerjee advises the Reserve Bank of India against cutting interest rates. He believes a rate cut now would be a wasted opportunity. Growth is strong and inflation is under control. The Monetary Policy Committee is unlikely to change rates in its upcoming February 2026 meeting. Private investment is not currently driven by interest rates.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman to present Budget on February 1; Parliament session likely from Jan 28
articles.summary: Parliament's Budget session is slated to begin on January 28 with President Murmu's address, followed by the Economic Survey on January 30. The Union Budget will be presented on February 1, a Sunday. Following discussions, Parliament will adjourn for a recess on February 13, reconvening on March 9 and concluding on April 2.

articles.title: India, EU reaffirm farmer, MSME safeguards at FTA talks
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in talks for a Free Trade Agreement. Discussions focus on a modern economic partnership. Both sides aim to safeguard farmers and MSMEs. Negotiations are ongoing to bridge differences. The goal is to conclude the talks soon. This pact could boost Indian exports to the EU market.

articles.title: CPSE Capex reached 74.5% of target by December, set to exceed annual target by fair margin
articles.summary: The Capex for the month of December alone increased by 9.28% to Rs 70,000 crore, with many enterprises exceeding their annual budget target. The growth was led by the Railway board and National Highway Authority of India(NHAI) as they remained the highest spenders.

articles.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
articles.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers. Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000. The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially. Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion. This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

articles.title: UN raises India's 2026 GDP forecast to 6.6%, pegs next yr's growth at 6.7%
articles.summary: India's economic horizon shines bright with projections of 6.6% growth by 2026 and 6.7% by 2027, as forecasted by the UN. This surge is fueled by vigorous consumer activity and substantial public investments. With supportive policy initiatives in place, India's position as one of the world's fastest-evolving economies is firmly established.

articles.title: Go Swadeshi: CEA V Anantha Nageswaran calls for urgent indigenisation amid global trade headwinds
articles.summary: The Chief Economic Adviser has spotlighted key industries such as semiconductors, defence production, and critical industrial chemicals for self-sufficiency. Targeting a decrease in import reliance, this plan aspires to elevate India's economic influence internationally.

articles.title: India to grow 6.6% in 2026 on strong consumption, public investment: UN
articles.summary: The UN has upgraded India's economic growth projection to 6.6% for 2026, citing resilient private consumption and strong public investment. Policy measures and lower interest rates are expected to boost near-term growth, with India projected to remain one of the fastest-growing economies globally.

articles.title: UN predicts world economic growth to slip to 2.7% in 2026
articles.summary: Global economic growth is set to slow in 2026 before picking up in 2027. The United States economy is expected to see modest growth. China's economy will continue its expansion. India's growth is projected to remain strong, supported by consumption and public investment. These forecasts come from a United Nations report.

articles.title: Over Rs 1.52 lakh cr locked in Customs disputes; govt may look at amnesty scheme in FY27 Budget
articles.summary: Price Waterhouse Co suggests the government consider an amnesty scheme in the 2026-27 Budget to resolve over Rs 1.52 lakh crore in customs duty litigations. The firm also advocates for rationalizing customs duty slabs to 5-6 and reducing duties on raw materials to address inverted duty structures arising from Free Trade Agreements.

articles.title: RBI considering fresh exporter relief steps after low take‑up of loan moratorium, sources say
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is exploring new measures to aid Indian exporters facing U.S. tariffs. A previous loan repayment moratorium saw limited participation. The central bank is now considering easing eligibility for the moratorium or offering fresh subsidized loans. Discussions are ongoing with export agencies to assess future order flows before finalizing new support.

articles.title: $25 million paycheck! Berkshire's new CEO Greg Abel will earn more than Warren Buffett ever did in salary
articles.summary: Berkshire Hathaway has raised the annual salary of its new chief executive Greg Abel to $25 million, a sharp jump from the $100,000 salary that Warren Buffett chose to draw for more than four decades while running the company, according to a Reuters report.

articles.title: Mcap of 7 of top-10 most valued firms erodes by Rs 3.63 lakh cr; Reliance biggest laggard
articles.summary: The combined market valuation of seven of the top-10 most valued firms eroded by Rs 3,63,412.18 crore last week, with Reliance Industries emerging as the biggest laggard, amid a bearish trend in equities.

articles.title: Lodha Developers acquires 5 land parcels in Q3 to build projects worth Rs 34,000 cr
articles.summary: Lodha Developers has acquired five land parcels in Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, and Bengaluru. These acquisitions are for projects with an estimated sales value of Rs 34,000 crore. The company aims to develop housing and commercial real estate on these sites. This move strengthens Lodha's future growth pipeline. The company is expanding its presence in the Delhi-NCR market.

articles.title: Narmadesh Brass Industries Rs 44.8-cr SME IPO to open on Monday
articles.summary: Gujarat-based Narmadesh Brass Industries, a manufacturer of brass products, announced on Sunday that its Rs 44.8-crore initial public offering will open for public subscription on the BSE's SME platform on January 12.

articles.title: FII comeback in 2026 was the bet, but Rs 12,000 crore exit spooks investors. What next?
articles.summary: Foreign investors have turned sellers in early 2026, offloading equities worth nearly Rs 12,000 crore in the first nine days. This unexpected trend, driven by geopolitical concerns and stalled India-US trade talks, has unsettled markets despite strong domestic buying and steady economic fundamentals.

articles.title: D-Street investors eye 11 IPOs this week; GMPs hint at up to 45% listing gains
articles.summary: A packed IPO calendar awaits investors next week, with 11 public issues in focus across mainboard and SME platforms. Of these, six IPOs are scheduled to open for subscription, while five companies are lined up to list, as grey market premiums (GMPs) point to potential listing gains of up to 45% in select names.

articles.title: HCL Tech Q3 Preview: Double-digit revenue growth, margin recovery eyed
articles.summary: HCL Technologies is expected to post a strong revenue performance in the December quarter, with brokerages forecasting around 12% year-on-year growth, supported by seasonality in products and ER D services, currency tailwinds and ramp-up of large deals.

articles.title: FMCG players witness strong Q3 recovery on demand surge, margin expansion
articles.summary: The FMCG sector anticipates strong volume growth and better operating margins for the December quarter. This positive outlook is fueled by GST reforms, robust festive sales, and easing raw material costs. Companies like Dabur, Marico, and Godrej Consumer Products report signs of recovery. Rural demand continues to outpace urban markets. Organized retail and e-commerce are also showing significant growth.

articles.title: TCS Q3 Preview: PAT may rise 6% YoY; margin pressure likely
articles.summary: TCS is expected to report steady but subdued performance in the December quarter, with brokerages estimating around 5% year-on-year revenue growth and about 6% profit growth amid cautious client spending and margin pressures. Q3 revenue is seen at Rs 67,000–67,500 crore and PAT at Rs 13,000–13,200 crore.

articles.title: 8 Nifty500 stocks with up to 75% upside. Do you own any?
articles.summary: Analyst forecasts go beyond mere numbers — they offer a strategic lens into future market potential. For investors looking out for the next breakout opportunity, Nifty500 stocks stand out as compelling picks. According to the estimates from Trendlyne, as many as Nifty500 stocks have the potential to deliver significant returns over the coming 12 months.These upside estimates, based on average analyst price targets, offer a data-driven reference point for investors scouting high-return opportunit

articles.title: Investor Alert: More data, better returns? Aswath Damodaran weighs in
articles.summary: Valuation expert Aswath Damodaran warns that an AI-driven data explosion doesn't guarantee better investment decisions. He cautions against false precision and overconfidence, emphasizing that true competitive advantage lies in interpretation and judgment, not just data access. Global markets saw significant growth in 2025, with technology leading sectors.

articles.title: Signature Global Q3 Results: Bookings fall 27% to Rs 2,020 cr on lower housing sales
articles.summary: Realty firm Signature Global on Sunday reported a 27 per cent decline in its sales bookings to Rs 2,020 crore for the quarter ended December, despite high festive demand for housing properties.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things to watch for stock market action on Monday
articles.summary: Indian stock markets ended Friday with losses for the fifth day straight. The Sensex and Nifty declined as global trade worries and political uncertainty impacted investor mood. Analysts noted a consolidation phase driven by weak global cues and foreign investor outflows. Despite this, domestic GDP growth is expected to remain strong, with Q3 results potentially stabilizing sentiment.

articles.title: Oil market dynamics: Factors that will drive prices in 2026
articles.summary: Crude oil posted its sharpest annual decline since 2020 in 2025, with Brent down 19% and WTI falling 20% as prices slid to near multi-year lows. Persistent oversupply, where global production consistently outpaced demand and inventories swelled, outweighed brief price support from geopolitical tensions, keeping the market under pressure.

articles.title: Trump tariffs, Q3 earnings among 8 factors to impact D-Street this week
articles.summary: Markets ended the week sharply lower as weak global cues and rising uncertainty triggered a broad risk-off move. Sentiment was hit by concerns over higher US tariffs on Indian exports, uncertainty around India–US trade ties, geopolitical tensions involving the US and Venezuela, and persistent selling by foreign institutional investors.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard alerts exchanges after employee shares draft Q3 results on WhatsApp
articles.summary: ICICI Lombard reported a corporate governance lapse after draft financial results were accidentally posted on a senior employee's personal WhatsApp status. The insurer promptly removed the post and informed stock exchanges as a precaution. This incident highlights concerns over safeguarding sensitive information amid informal messaging, following a similar case with Hatsun Agro Product.

articles.title: SEBI chairman Tuhin Kanta says NSE IPO NOC in advanced stages; likely to come...
How 2026 is shaping up for Indian investors? Gurmeet Chadha shares his asset class view
articles.summary: As global macro conditions shift, investors are rethinking asset allocation for 2026. Gurmeet Chadha of Complete Circle Consultants highlights constructive prospects for Indian equities, caution on silver, moderation in global AI-led trades, and potential outperformance in long-duration bonds, supported by fiscal strength and likely inclusion in the global bond index.

articles.title: Sebi likely to approve NSE IPO this month, says chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey
articles.summary: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the regulator is in the advanced stages of granting a no-objection certificate for the long-pending NSE IPO, likely within this month. NSE’s listing process, delayed since 2016 due to regulatory clearances, has progressed after corrective measures and the settlement of past cases.

articles.title: DMart Q3 Results: Cons profit jumps 18% YoY to Rs 856 crore, revenue up 13%
articles.summary: Avenue Supermarts, the parent of DMart, posted strong Q3 FY26 numbers with consolidated PAT rising 18.3% YoY to Rs 855.92 crore, compared to Rs 723.72 crore a year earlier. Revenue from operations grew 13.3% YoY to Rs 18,100.88 crore, up from Rs 15,972.55 crore in the same quarter last fiscal.

articles.title: Dalal Street Week Ahead: Nifty tests key support levels as volatility rises
articles.summary: Nifty broke below its 500-point trading range, ending the week down 2.45% amid global uncertainty and a spike in volatility. Technical indicators signal weakening momentum, with support at 25,500–25,300 crucial. Sectoral trends show Services, Pharma, Infra and BFSI outperforming, while FMCG, Energy and Realty lag on relative strength.

articles.title: Asset manager Aberdeen trims Venezuela bonds after stunning rally
articles.summary: Aberdeen Investments is reducing its stake in Venezuela's defaulted bonds. These bonds have seen a significant price increase over the past year. Portfolio manager Kevin Daly cited high tail risk as the reason for this prudent move. Despite recent gains, the path to debt restructuring remains challenging due to ongoing US sanctions.

articles.title: Argentina pays $4.3 billion to bondholders, meeting critical deadline
articles.summary: Argentina has successfully paid $4.3 billion to sovereign bondholders, meeting its January 9 deadline. This crucial payment, despite low foreign reserves, aims to boost investor confidence and reopen international capital markets. The government is keen to signal stability as more significant repayments loom, including to the IMF. Analysts are watching for a positive market reaction and potential reserve rebuilding.

articles.title: Techno Paints to raise Rs 500 cr through IPO in FY27, appoints Sachin Tendulkar as brand ambassador
articles.summary: Techno Paints and Chemicals is planning a Rs 500 crore IPO next fiscal year and has appointed Sachin Tendulkar as its brand ambassador for three years. The paint manufacturer aims to strengthen its national presence and expand its operations across India and into the Middle East.

articles.title: F&O Talk | Nifty cracks after new high: Is this the start of a deeper fall? Sudeep Shah answers
articles.summary: Markets witnessed one of the sharpest weekly declines in recent months as global risks and heavy selling dragged indices lower. Technical expert Sudeep Shah explains whether this move signals deeper correction and outlines key levels, sector strategies and near-term market triggers.

articles.title: Bitcoin consolidates between $88,000 and $92,000 as drawdown remains far milder than past cycles
articles.summary: Bitcoin trades within a narrow $88,000 to $92,000 range as its current drawdown remains far shallower than in previous market cycles. Analysts highlight muted volatility, steady capital flows and neutral technical indicators amid a wait for fresh macro catalysts.

articles.title: Stablecoin transactions rose to record $33 trillion in 2025
articles.summary: Stablecoin transactions surged to a record $33 trillion in 2025, driven by supportive US policy under President Trump and rapid institutional adoption. USDC led with $18.3 trillion in flows, outpacing Tether’s USDT. Rising usage outside DeFi signals broader mainstream demand for digital dollars amid global economic uncertainty.

articles.title: European stocks close at record as Glencore jumps on Rio Tinto interest
articles.summary: European stock markets reached a new peak on Friday. Glencore's significant jump fueled the rise. Technology stocks also performed strongly, marking their best week in almost two years. This rebound shows investor resilience despite global concerns. Defence stocks saw notable weekly gains. The US jobs report indicated cooling growth, reinforcing expectations of steady interest rates.

articles.title: Moody’s affirms Shriram Finance’s Ba1 rating, outlook revised to positive after MUFG Bank investment
articles.summary: Moody’s has affirmed Shriram Finance’s Ba1 rating and revised its outlook to positive following MUFG Bank’s planned $4.4 billion investment for a 20% stake. The capital infusion is expected to strengthen SFL’s capitalisation, funding access, and profitability, positioning it among India’s highest-capitalised non-banking finance companies.

articles.title: TCS, Kotak Bank among 8 stocks nearing ex-dates for bonus, dividend, and stock split. Do you own any?
articles.summary: ​TCS, Kotak Bank and six other companies are set for stock splits, bonus issues, and dividends next week, offering opportunities for investors.

articles.title: India’s defence order pipeline hits record levels; Astra Microwave, Bharat Dynamics top buys
articles.summary: India's defence manufacturing sector sees enhanced medium-term visibility due to accelerated capital acquisition approvals, with FY26 year-to-date clearances nearly double the annual outlay. This robust pipeline, spanning diverse military needs and emphasizing integrated systems, de-risks future order inflows for the sector over the next two to four years.

articles.title: Concurrent Losers: 12 stocks decline for five consecutive sessions
articles.summary: Indian markets remained under pressure as the Sensex declined for a fifth straight session. Twelve BSE 100 stocks recorded losses in all five sessions, reflecting sustained selling across sectors amid broader market weakness and cautious investor sentiment.

articles.title: IPO Calendar: Amagi Media Labs to headline over Rs 2000 crore pipeline as six issues open for subscription next week
articles.summary: India’s primary market gears up for a busy week as six IPOs open for subscription, led by Amagi Media Labs. Alongside five SME issues, strong demand for Bharat Coking Coal highlights investor interest amid ongoing market volatility.

articles.title: IREDA Q3 Results: PAT jumps 15% YoY to Rs 1,381 crore, revenue up 28%
articles.summary: IREDA posted a 15.4% YoY rise in Q3 FY26 PAT at Rs 1,381 crore, with revenue up 28.2% to Rs 6,042 crore. Loan sanctions jumped 29% YoY to Rs 40,100 crore, while disbursements rose 44% to Rs 24,903 crore. Strong domestic borrowings and diversified clean energy lending underpin robust growth and execution visibility.

articles.title: Dollar set for second straight weekly gain after US jobs data
articles.summary: The dollar strengthened on Friday following weaker-than-expected U.S. jobs growth, suggesting the Federal Reserve may hold interest rates steady. The yen weakened as Japan's Prime Minister considers a snap election, while the euro declined against the dollar amid mixed European economic data.

articles.title: Oil gains as market weighs Iran, Russia supply risks; dealmaking for Venezuela in focus
articles.summary: Oil prices saw a significant jump on Friday. Growing concerns over supply disruptions in Iran due to intensifying protests are impacting the market. Escalating attacks in Russia's war in Ukraine are also contributing to these worries. Despite these factors, global oil inventories are rising, potentially capping further price increases. Market focus is now on Venezuelan oil export deals.

articles.title: Gold set for weekly gain on US payrolls miss, broader uncertainty
articles.summary: Gold prices surged this week, nearing record highs, driven by weaker U.S. jobs data and escalating global uncertainties. Investors are anticipating Federal Reserve rate cuts, a traditional boost for precious metals. Geopolitical tensions, including conflicts in Ukraine and unrest in Iran, further fueled demand.

articles.title: Torrent Pharma eyes Rs 12,500-crore bond sale next week. Check details
articles.summary: Next week, Torrent Pharmaceuticals is set to launch a hefty debt sale, targeting around ₹12,500 crore in fundraising. This capital will play a critical role in facilitating the company's acquisition of JB Chemicals Pharmaceuticals. The strategy includes issuing commercial paper and non-convertible debentures, showcasing the increasing reliance on debt markets for corporate buyouts.

articles.title: US stocks scale fresh record high after unemployment rate improves
articles.summary: U.S. stocks reached record highs Friday following a mixed jobs report. While hiring slowed, the unemployment rate improved, suggesting a stable job market that might delay but not eliminate Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. Energy and housing sectors saw significant gains, while General Motors faced a substantial hit due to its EV pullback.

articles.title: Sebi approves 5 IPOs including that of Kissht and Alcobrew Distilleries
articles.summary: Sebi has approved five IPOs across sectors including digital lending, alcoholic beverages, textiles and precision engineering. Major issuers include Kissht, Alcobrew Distilleries, Aastha Spintex, Indo MIM and Kusumgar, signalling a strong and diverse primary market pipeline.

articles.title: Walmart to join Nasdaq-100, replacing AstraZeneca from January 20
articles.summary: Walmart will replace AstraZeneca in the Nasdaq-100 Index on January 20 following its move from the NYSE. The shift aligns with Walmart’s strategy to access a tech-savvy investor base, optimise listing costs, and leverage Nasdaq’s trading infrastructure. The inclusion reflects the company’s prominence among the largest non-financial U.S. firms.

articles.title: Wall Street Week Ahead: Earnings start, inflation data pose tests for resilient US stocks
articles.summary: Indian markets are off to a strong start in 2026, but investors should brace for potential volatility. Corporate earnings, crucial inflation data, and escalating geopolitical tensions are on the horizon. Despite a robust bull market, analysts caution that current optimism might be overlooking upcoming challenges, urging a look at defensive strategies.

articles.title: ET Market Watch: Sensex cracks 2,350 pts in a week, trade jitters, FII selling hit stocks
India should prioritise Indic AI models instead of foundational ones: OpenAI researcher
articles.summary: Sushant Sachdeva urged India to focus on AI models for local languages rather than competing with the US and China on large foundation models. He said India can use existing public models to serve its linguistically diverse population. His remarks come as the government and startups boost efforts in homegrown AI development.

articles.title: xAI locked out of Claude as Anthropic enforces competitor rules
articles.summary: Anthropic has blocked xAI from using its Claude AI models after xAI accessed them through the Cursor coding tool, citing rules against aiding competitors. xAI cofounder Tony Wu said this will slow productivity but push them to build their own tools. This comes just as Elon Musk announced that X’s recommendation algorithm will be open-sourced soon.

articles.title: Malaysia suspends access to Musk's Grok AI
articles.summary: Malaysia has blocked access to Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot after it was widely misused to create pornographic and abusive images. Regulators said safeguards were weak, despite earlier warnings, and cited sexualised content involving women and children. Access will return only after changes are made, following similar action by Indonesia earlier.

articles.title: AI pendants back in vogue at tech show after early setback
articles.summary: Pendants and brooches packed with artificial intelligence abounded at the Consumer Electronics show, using cameras and microphones to watch and listen through the day like a vigilant personal assistant. Nonetheless, at the CES show in Las Vegas, gadget makers have pitched AI pendants as note-takers or ways to remember beautiful or important moments of each day.

articles.title: Indian IT leaders focus on agentic AI for growth, majority of them find AI augmenting talent: Survey
articles.summary: Indian IT leaders are embracing agentic AI for business growth. This autonomous AI technology is a top priority, unlike in Western markets. Indian enterprises are preparing for AI-led business models. AI initiatives are enhancing skills and speed, augmenting talent. New roles are emerging from human-AI collaboration. Indian leaders expect significant revenue uplift from AI within five years.

articles.title: AI toys look for bright side after troubled start
articles.summary: Toy makers at the Consumer Electronics Show were adamant about being careful to ensure that their fun creations infused with generative artificial intelligence don't turn naughty. Toy giant Mattel, meanwhile, made no mention of the report in mid-December when it postponed the release of its first toy developed in partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI.

articles.title: China is closing in on US technology lead despite constraints, AI researchers say
articles.summary: China can narrow its technological gap with the US driven by growing risk-taking ‍and innovation, though the lack of ​advanced chipmaking tools is hobbling the sector, the country's leading artificial intelligence ⁠researchers said.

articles.title: India AI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious India AI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: IndiaAI Mission fuels startup ecosystem, strengthens push to make India 'global AI producer': Experts
articles.summary: Industry leaders and startup ecosystem enablers have hailed the Government of India's ambitious IndiaAI Mission, calling it a transformative step toward making India a global hub for artificial intelligence by the end of this decade.

articles.title: PM Modi tells IndiaAI startups to showcase local AI use cases at February summit
articles.summary: The PM held a closed-door meeting at his residence on January 8 with about a dozen founders from the IndiaAI Mission cohort. Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and senior officials of MeitY also attended the meeting. Modi told the founders to develop safe and authenticated AI, prioritising trust, transparency, and watermarking in their models to build user confidence and comply with evolving regulations.

articles.title: Nine ITIs in Odisha to get AI labs: CM Mohan Charan Majhi
articles.summary: Odisha chief minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Friday said artificial intelligence (AI) laboratories are being set up in nine Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs) of the state.

articles.title: Brew, smell, and serve: AI steals the show at CES 2026
articles.summary: AI dominated CES 2026, from voice-controlled espresso machines by Bosch using Amazon Alexa, to personalised perfumes from DigitalScent. Tennis robots from UBTech and Tenniix showcased AI-driven realism in sport and lifestyle tech.

articles.title: AI gobbling up memory chips essential to gadget makers
articles.summary: At the Consumer Electronics Show, gadget makers warned of a global DRAM shortage driven by booming AI demand. Memory prices are soaring, boosting revenues at Samsung Electronics and Micron Technology. IDC says shortages may last into next year, forcing higher prices and fewer device features.

articles.title: Indonesia temporarily blocks access to Grok over sexualised images
articles.summary: xAI, the startup behind Grok, said on Thursday it was restricting image generation and editing to paying subscribers as it tried ​to fix safeguard lapses that ​had allowed sexualised outputs including depictions of scantily ‌clad ‍children.

articles.title: OpenAI, SoftBank invest $1 billion in Stargate partner SB Energy
articles.summary: OpenAI and SoftBank will each invest $500 million in SB Energy to support the energy firm’s growth as a data center developer and operator, the companies said in a statement Friday. OpenAI also said it has selected SB Energy to build and operate its 1.2 gigawatt data center in Milam County, Texas. A single gigawatt is enough to power roughly 750,000 US homes at any given moment.

articles.title: AI comes of age while some of its founders are yet to
articles.summary: The average age of newbies starting up is coming down to 20s with teens, native to disruptive tech, becoming part of conversation.

articles.title: PM Modi to Indian AI startups: Build LLMs for global good
articles.summary: At a closed-door meeting with the top leadership of 12 AI startups, Modi also called for harnessing the transformative technology for public good, with a focus on solving both Indian and global challenges, multiple founders told ET.

articles.title: CES 2026: From digital to physical, AI is touching every aspect of consumer life
articles.summary: The ‘world’s largest tech fair’, as CES is popularly called, delivered a dose of wonder and whimsy, along with futuristic technology, and much AI-powered consumer gear. While technology managed to bring the world together at Las Vegas in the first working week of 2026, geopolitics in this changing global order cast its shadow as well.

articles.title: Why Meta is lining up massive supply of nuclear power
articles.summary: The parent company of Facebook on Friday announced agreements with TerraPower, Oklo and Vistra for nuclear power for its Prometheus AI data center that is being built in New Albany, Ohio. Meta announced Prometheus, which will be a 1-gigawatt cluster spanning across multiple data center buildings, in July. It's anticipated to come online this year.

articles.title: Elon Musk's AI is generating sexualised images of real people, fueling outrage
articles.summary: Late Thursday, the Grok account on X started limiting requests for AI images to site subscribers who pay for certain premium features, according to posts from the chatbot. The change followed a "backlash over its ability to create sexualized deepfakes without consent," the AI chatbot added, but users can "subscribe or switch to the standalone Grok site for similar functions."

articles.title: Germany plans measures to combat harmful AI image manipulation
articles.summary: Germany's justice ministry plans to present measures in the ‍near future that would allow ​authorities to more effectively combat the use of artificial ⁠intelligence to manipulate images in ways that violate personal rights, a spokesperson said.

articles.title: Dutch couple's marriage annulled due to ChatGPT speech
articles.summary: A Dutch couple had ‍their marriage annulled after ​the person officiating used a ChatGPT-generated ⁠speech that was intended to be playful but failed to meet legal requirements, according to a court ‌ruling published this ‌week.

articles.title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $60 million this week, down 79% on-year
articles.summary: The number of deals during the week was also down at just 19 transactions, compared to 34 in the corresponding week last year.

articles.title: DeepSeek to launch new AI model focused on coding in February: Report
articles.summary: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek is reportedly preparing to release its new V4 model next month. This advanced AI is expected to excel in coding tasks, possibly surpassing competitors. A key feature is its ability to process very long coding instructions. This development could significantly benefit developers working on complex software projects.

articles.title: Skydo receives final RBI nod to operate as cross-border payment aggregator
articles.summary: With the approval, Skydo joins a group of fintech firms that have secured the licence since the RBI introduced the PA-CB regime for tighter oversight of cross-border payment flows. Other companies that have secured the licence include Razorpay, Cashfree Payments, Amazon Pay, BillDesk, and Adyen.

articles.title: India a key growth engine for Snowflake: CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy
articles.summary: Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy added that the company is making investments in the country to build an AI-ready workforce, noting that it has a large team in Pune and offices in Delhi and Bengaluru.

articles.title: SoftBank pares Ola Electric stake; Snowflake CEO on AI & search
articles.summary: SoftBank continues its Ola Electric selling spree. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Stablecoin firm Rain valued at $1.95 billion in latest fundraise
articles.summary: Stablecoin firm Rain ​said on Friday it has raised $250 million in a ⁠funding round led by ICONIQ, valuing the company at $1.95 billion, as investor interest in the crypto sector continues to grow.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi Metro phase 5A approved: 13 stations, 16 km corridor at ₹12,015 crore
Beyond 1 crore WhatsApp bans; Oyo's third attempt at IPO
articles.summary: The government wants to know more about accounts banned by WhatsApp in India. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation
School assembly news headlines for December 23: Top national, international business & sports updates
articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: India fast-tracks key reforms to shield itself from US tariffs
articles.summary: In its final parliament session of the year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through major economic reforms aimed at boosting growth amid trade challenges. Parliament approved bills allowing private investment in nuclear energy, full foreign ownership of insurance firms, and a unified securities market code.

articles.title: India valuations fair, earnings key to upside over next 12 months: Mark Matthews
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are poised for steady, healthy growth, driven by the gradual payoff of fiscal and monetary stimulus. While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

articles.title: Catching the Market’s Swing: How traders ride market moves across India, US and global bourses
articles.summary: Swing trading sits comfortably between long-term investing and high-frequency day trading, appealing to market participants who want to capture short- to medium-term price movements without being glued to screens all day.

articles.title: India’s growth story intact despite FII outflows, sentiment the key risk: Jim Walker

He believes recent selling is profit-taking, with investors likely to regret overlooking India's long-term fundamentals and domestic growth drivers.

articles.title: US banking groups warn 10% credit card interest cap could be 'devastating' for consumers
articles.summary: US banking groups have opposed President Trump’s proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10%, warning it could reduce access to credit for families and small businesses.

articles.title: Trump delivers oil warning, suggesting Cuba should strike a deal with US
articles.summary: Venezuela is Cuba's biggest oil supplier, but since the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by U.S. forces, Trump has successfully pressed interim President Delcy Rodriguez to send Venezuelan oil to the United States.

articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates remaining phase 2 stretch of metro service in Gandhinagar
articles.summary: PM Modi flagged off a metro service at the Mahatma Mandir metro station in Gandhinagar, marking the inauguration of the service between Sector 10A of Gandhinagar to the Mahatma Mandir convention centre. This stretch, which covers Sachivalaya complex, Akshardham Temple, old Sachivalaya, Sector 16 and 24, is part of phase II of the Metro service connecting Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar.

articles.title: Inside Tokyo’s ice-cold new year purification ritual at Teppozu Inari Shrine

articles.summary: Stocks including ITC, NTPC, Vedanta, DMart, and Lemon Tree Hotels will be in focus on January 12 on deal announcements, business updates and Q3 earnings.

articles.title: When is Pongal 2026? Date, time, rituals and significance
articles.summary: Pongal is a symbol of respect for the natural world, the abundance of agriculture, and the life-giving force of the Sun. Pongal will be celebrated across January 2026 as a four-day festival.

articles.title: Adani Group to invest ₹1.5 lakh crore in Kutch, boost energy and port capacity
articles.summary: "We will complete our Khavda project and commission the full 37 GW capacity by 2030, and we will also double our port capacity at Mundra in 10 years,” he said

articles.title: ISRO begins countdown for first launch of the year with PSLV mission
articles.summary: PSLV-C62 rocket to deploy earth observation satellite and 14 co-passenger satellites on January 12.

articles.summary: The directives also discourage Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) and Initial Token Offerings (ITOs), equivalent to IPOs in stock markets, by the exchanges.

articles.title: 2026 Kia Seltos Review: Stepping out of the Creta’s shadow with sharper design, better tech and mature road manners
articles.summary: With a longer wheelbase, upgraded infotainment, enhanced ADAS features and a more compliant suspension, the 2026 Kia Seltos marks a clear shift toward maturity, positioning itself as a tech-forward and comfort-focused midsize SUV rather than merely a Creta alternative.

articles.summary: As AI, influencers and data-led platforms reshape advertising, India’s top creative leaders argue that the real battle is no longer about who makes content faster, but who can build brands with consistency, craft and cultural relevance in a fragmented digital economy.

articles.summary: CII urged the government to mobilise resources through a calibrated approach to privatisation, focusing on sectors where private participation can enhance efficiency, technology infusion, and global competitiveness.

articles.summary: Mahayuti unveils Mumbai civic poll manifesto promising AI-driven governance, 50 percent BEST fare concession for women, flood-free Mumbai, climate action, and preservation of Marathi culture.

articles.title: In Pics | PM Modi leads Shaurya Yatra, plays damru during Somnath Swabhiman Parv

The festival marks 1,000 years since Mahmud of Ghazni’s first attack on the Somnath temple in 1026, according to officials. Here are some of the key highlights from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Somnath during the Somnath Swabhiman Parv.

articles.summary: Amitabh Bachchan's 5.72-acre Shahpur village land near GIFT City will be developed by Abhishek Bachchan and Lotus Developers into an ultra-luxury mixed-use project over four years.

articles.summary: Placing the state’s requirements before the Centre, the deputy chief minister highlights priority infrastructure projects, including the augmentation of water supply and drainage systems in Itanagar and other urban areas.

articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the Somnath Temple Shaurya Yatra, featuring 108 Gujarat Police horses, dance performances, and tributes to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel during Somnath Swabhiman Parv.

articles.summary: ”Goa’s perspectives, demands, and developmental requirements were presented, with a focus on sustaining momentum in critical infrastructure projects,” he said.

articles.title: 27 Indian nationals successfully rescued and repatriated from Myanmar
articles.summary: Twenty-seven Indian nationals, trafficked to Myanmar with false job offers, were rescued and repatriated after intervention by Ram Mohan Naidu and MEA, returning safely to New Delhi.

articles.summary: The yatra, being organised as part of the Somnath Swabhiman Parv, featured a procession of 108 horses, reflecting valour and sacrifice.

articles.title: X accepts mistake in allowing obscene content on Grok, deletes 600 accounts
articles.summary: X admitted error over obscene Grok AI content, blocked 3500 items and deleted 600 accounts. Government warned of legal action and demanded stricter measures. X pledged compliance with Indian laws.

articles.title: Goa records highest tourist footfall at 1.08 crore in 2025; foreign visitors top 5 lakh
articles.summary: Goa recorded 1.02 crore domestic tourists and 5.17 lakh foreign tourists, aggregating to 1.08 crore total arrivals, the state Tourism Department said in its data released on Sunday.
