articles.summary: Our weekly quiz on business creativity. Read, learn, share!

articles.title: X admits mistake on Grok AI content, vows to comply with Indian laws
articles.summary: After an IT Ministry warning, X admitted its mistake on Grok AI's obscene content. It blocked 3,500 posts, deleted 600 accounts, and assured full compliance with Indian laws.

articles.title: Karnataka to host India’s first commercial Quantum computer at IIIT-Dharwad
articles.summary: State bets big on frontier computing, announcing deployment of a cutting-edge machine at IIIT-Dharwad as part of a broader push to build an advanced deeptech ecosystem and attract next-generation research and talent.

articles.title: PhonePe launches 'PG Bolt' for one-click payments amid IPO push
articles.summary: PhonePe has introduced 'PhonePe PG Bolt', a 6-second checkout solution for Visa and Mastercard users. By utilising device tokenisation, it eliminates repetitive CVV entries and redirects.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu unveils Deep Tech Startup Policy with Rs 100 Cr push
articles.summary: The key goals of the policy include a 25% increase in annual patent filings by deep tech startups, training of over 10,000 students and professionals in deep tech skills.

articles.title: India must build transparent, unbiased AI rooted in local data: PM Modi
articles.summary: Chairing a roundtable with Indian AI startups ahead of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, PM Modi suggested that the startups should work towards global leadership from this country, and noted that India can promote affordable and inclusive AI and frugal innovation globally.

articles.title: [Weekly funding roundup Jan 3-9] Startup investments begin on a subdued note
articles.summary: This drop is not surprising, given that there is usually a slow start to funding in January, which was also seen in 2025.

articles.title: Transactions that shaped 2025; AI experiments to enterprise solutions
articles.summary: YourStory decodes the 228 billion transactions that shaped 2025. Aivar is expanding its footprint across India, the US, and the Middle East. Aspiring Leaders India Foundation’s programme breaks down leadership into learnable, practical components.

articles.title: Eternal and its GST shortfalls; Inside edtech startup Instrucko
articles.summary: Eternal, formerly known as Zomato, has received consecutive tax orders from West Bengal authorities demanding a total of approximately Rs 31.25 crore, inclusive of interest and penalties.

articles.title: Beyond AI hype: Why data is the real competitive moat
articles.summary: In an exclusive conversation, leaders discuss why data - not AI alone - is becoming the true differentiator for serving underserved customers, building resilient healthcare systems, and scaling startups in 2026.

articles.title: NTPC to set up coal-to-SNG project at ₹10,000 crore capex in Chhattisgarh
articles.summary: This ambitious project, with an investment of approximately ₹10,000 crore, aims to produce synthetic natural gas from high-ash Indian coal. The facility will be located at Talaipalli and is expected to consume substantial amounts of coal. Technology tie-ups are underway to finalize the project s processes.

articles.title: ONGC brings Mori-5 well under control within five days after blowout
articles.summary: State-owned explorer says rapid response after blowout during workover ranks among its fastest containment efforts.

articles.title: Govt weighs extending presumptive tax regime to renewable energy sector
articles.summary: This move aims to attract foreign expertise for setting up solar plants and participating in the value chain. The government is evaluating revenue implications before a final decision, aligning with its clean energy expansion goals.

articles.title: Renewable energy usage norms may be eased for energy derived from waste
articles.summary: According to draft procedures for RCO compliance mechanism, issued by the Bureau of Energy Efficiency, the exemption covers self-consumed electricity generated through waste recovery, including from byproduct gases, or other forms of residual energy sources associated with industrial processes

articles.title: PIB clears ₹26,000-crore Kamala Hydel Project in Arunachal
articles.summary: This advancement is set to enhance flood control and provide free energy to the residents of Arunachal Pradesh. Moreover, an additional ₹3,000 crore has been earmarked for establishing state-of-the-art power equipment testing facilities.

articles.title: New tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: US' solar alliance pull-out throws spanner in works for ties with India
articles.summary: The US departure is part of a broader policy shift. The International Solar Alliance was launched by India and France. It works to promote solar energy in developing nations. The US joined the alliance in 2021.

articles.title: Torrent Power bets ₹1 lakh crore on energy, builds new B2C platforms: Jinal Mehta, vice-chairman and MD
articles.summary: Torrent Power operates across the entire power value chain-coal-based and gas-based generation, renewables, transmission and distribution. We are also expanding into energy storage and green hydrogen. Importantly, every segment of the value chain is seeing growth today, giving us multiple growth engines and a balanced portfolio, says Jinal Mehta.

articles.title: Punjab government preparing youth for competitive exams through Mission Pragati: CM Mann
articles.summary: Punjab's youth are set to benefit from Mission Pragati, a new government initiative offering free academic and physical training for competitive exams. Chief Minister Bhagwant Singh Mann announced the program, designed to support rural and meritorious students, with the first batch already enrolled. This 'youth helping youth' model aims for holistic development and increased representation in government jobs.

articles.title: Delhi government to fast-track 4 drainage projects to fix waterlogging
articles.summary: Delhi government has fast-tracked four major drainage projects to combat chronic waterlogging across the capital. These initiatives, including the Mundka supplementary drain and MB Road stormwater drain, aim to modernize infrastructure, ensure swift rainwater discharge into the Yamuna, and reduce pressure on the sewerage network, providing lasting relief from monsoon flooding.

articles.title: 'Slogans don't hide zero representation': Union minister Bandi Sanjay on Owaisi's 'burqa-clad PM' remark; hits back at AIMIM chief
‘Where has its nationalism gone?’: Asaduddin Owaisi accuses Centre of double standards on China investments; targets silence on Donald Trump remarks
articles.summary: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the BJP government's nationalism, citing its invitation to Chinese companies despite security concerns and its silence on US President Donald Trump's alleged insults. Owaisi also criticized the Centre's asylum for Sheikh Hasina and the prolonged incarceration of Muslim youth without trial.

articles.title: ‘Why did she go there?’: How the onus of safety keeps falling on women
articles.summary: Public discourse on sexual violence consistently shifts blame from perpetrators to victims, focusing on women's choices and behavior rather than men's decisions. Despite widespread criticism, this regressive mindset persists across politics, courts, and families, implying women must alter their lives to prevent crimes they do not commit.

articles.title: 'Chinki, momo, Chinese': How everyday racism shadows Indians from the Northeast
articles.summary: Northeastern Indians face persistent racial slurs and discrimination across India, from casual prejudice to fatal violence. Incidents like Anjel Chakma's death highlight how stereotypes about appearance and food habits lead to abuse and exclusion, even in supposedly cosmopolitan cities calling for stronger laws and societal change to foster true inclusivity.

articles.title: Evening news wrap: PM leads Somnath Shaurya Yatra; Iran warns US of retaliation and more
ED may attach Al Falah University campus under anti-money laundering law
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate may attach Al Falah University's Faridabad campus under anti-money laundering laws. Officials suspect illicit funds were used for its construction, following the arrest of Al Falah Group chairman Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui on money laundering charges. The university's alleged false accreditation claims are under scrutiny.

articles.title: No Rahul-Stalin in Tamil Nadu? DMK rejects Congress‘s 'sharing power’ proposal; CM firm on stand
articles.summary: Senior DMK leader I Periyasamy has firmly ruled out any coalition government in Tamil Nadu, stating chief minister M K Stalin is resolute against sharing power with allies, including the Congress. This assertion comes as the Tamil Nadu Congress renews its demand for a share in governance ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

articles.title: 'Even LoP is not safe': BJP on Suvendu Adhikari convoy 'attack'; MHA seeks report from his office
ECI clears 'plantation records' as valid SIR documents in north Bengal, says BJP's Suvendu
articles.summary: The Election Commission of India has approved the use of tea garden and cinchona plantation employment records as valid identity and residence documents for electoral roll revision in seven North Bengal districts.

articles.title: ‘Misleading narrative’: Chirag Paswan hits out at opposition over VB-G RAM G protest, calls it ‘help’ in winning Bengal
articles.summary: Union minister Chirag Paswan accused the Congress and RJD of spreading a misleading narrative around government schemes like VB-G RAM G, claiming their protests would electorally benefit the NDA. Paswan defended the new scheme, emphasizing collective responsibility and improved focus on infrastructure projects, while criticizing the Congress for alleged corruption in MGNREGA.

articles.title: ‘Journey from 20% to 30% and 40% won’t be that long’: Amit Shah says BJP vote share rising in Kerala; confident of forming government in 2026
articles.summary: Union home minister Amit Shah expressed confidence in the BJP's growing support in Kerala, predicting a victory in the upcoming Assembly elections. He highlighted the party's increasing vote share and recent local body successes, attributing them to dedicated workers.

articles.title: 'Evolving, yet unchanged': Mohan Bhagwat on RSS’s growth; draws seed–tree parallel
Watch: NSUI protests against VB-GRAMG scheme in UP; security tightened in Varanasi, Lucknow
articles.summary: The National Students' Union of India (NSUI) protested the VB-GRAMG scheme across Uttar Pradesh, including Lucknow and Varanasi, on Sunday. Demonstrations in Lucknow saw workers detained by security. In Varanasi, heightened security surrounded Prime Minister Modi's public outreach office ahead of a planned "Save MGNREGA" march, with police and paramilitary forces on alert.

articles.title: When disasters strike, preparation saves lives — is India ready when crisis hits?
articles.summary: India faces escalating disaster risks due to geography, climate change, and development patterns, as starkly illustrated in 2025 by devastating floods and heatwaves. While response capacity has improved, a persistent imbalance favors reactive relief over proactive preparedness, a gap highlighted by contrasting events like Cyclone Phailin and Bihar's recurring floods.

articles.title: ‘From Ghazni to Aurangzeb’: PM Modi invokes history at Somnath; underscores temple’s resilience
articles.summary: Addressing a gathering during the Somnath Swabhiman Parv, PM Modi said: "Those present here, your ancestors, our ancestors, bet their lives for their faith, for their belief, for Mahadev - they sacrificed everything they had". Without taking names, PM Modi attacked the Congress-led government for "whitewashing the history" that encapsulates the multiple attacks by Mughal invaders on the Somnath temple.

articles.title: ‘Undoubtedly a ratna’:RJD takes jibe at Nitish Kumar amid Bharat Ratna push; questions merit
articles.summary: Amidst calls for Nitish Kumar to receive the Bharat Ratna, RJD MP Sudhakar Singh acknowledged his long service as Bihar CM, even while unwell, as a testament to his worthiness. Union Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi and JD(U) leader KC Tyagi also championed the Bihar chief minister for the nation's highest civilian honour, citing his 'exemplary governance' and socialist credentials.

articles.title: ‘Unprecedented certainty in India’: PM Modi raises investment pitch amid global uncertainty; highlights political stability, policy continuity
Crypto rules tightened: Live selfies, geo-tagging mandatory for users; FIU rolls out tougher KYC norms
articles.summary: India's Financial Intelligence Unit has mandated stringent AML/KYC norms for crypto exchanges, requiring live selfie verification and geographical tracking during user onboarding. These new rules classify exchanges as VDA service providers and aim to enhance transparency and combat illicit financial activities.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Govt should avoid hiking surcharge on super-rich, reviving wealth tax; why experts warn of capital flight
articles.summary: Tax experts are advising the government against increasing income tax surcharges or reintroducing a wealth tax in the upcoming budget. They warn that such measures could lead wealthy individuals to relocate to low-tax jurisdictions, negatively impacting investment and job creation in India.

articles.title: Market sell-off: 7 of top-10 firms lose Rs 3.63 lakh crore in a week; Reliance, HDFC Bank biggest drags
articles.summary: Indian equity markets experienced a significant downturn last week, with the top 10 most valued companies collectively losing over Rs 3.6 lakh crore. Reliance Industries bore the brunt of the sell-off, followed by HDFC Bank and Bharti Airtel. This decline was attributed to global economic uncertainties and geopolitical tensions.

This spiritual foundation underpins his journey to the Premier League's elite this January 2026.
